headline: US pharma giant Merck ditches plan for $1.4-bn research centre in UK
summary: Merck, the US pharmaceutical group, said on Wednesday it has dropped plans to build a $1.4-billion research centre in Britain, blaming the country's "lack of investment" in the sector and its drugs prices.Merck's decision follows that of UK sectoral rival AstraZeneca to abandon plans to build a $540-million vaccine factory in Britain, in the Liverpool region, because of what it said were insufficient state incentives.

raw.headline: US pharma giant Merck ditches plan for $1.4-bn research centre in UK
raw.summary: Merck, the US pharmaceutical group, said on Wednesday it has dropped plans to build a $1.4-billion research centre in Britain, blaming the country's "lack of investment" in the sector and its drugs prices.Merck's decision follows that of UK sectoral rival AstraZeneca to abandon plans to build a $540-million vaccine factory in Britain, in the Liverpool region, because of what it said were insufficient state incentives.

headline: US drugmaker scraps plans for £1bn UK research centre
summary: One of America’s largest drug companies has ditched plans to open a £1bn research centre in London amid a growing row with the Government over surging NHS charges.

raw.headline: US drugmaker scraps plans for £1bn UK research centre
raw.summary: One of America’s largest drug companies has ditched plans to open a £1bn research centre in London amid a growing row with the Government over surging NHS charges.

headline: Merck to scrap London drug research centre
summary: The U.S. drugmaker no longer plans to occupy the Belgrove House site at King's Cross, which was due to open in 2027.  Pharmaceutical companies have been shoring up investments in the U.S. amid the Trump administration's tariff threats and pressure to move more manufacturing to the U.S.  Merck said its decision "reflects the challenges of the UK not making meaningful progress towards addressing the lack of investment in the life science industry and the overall undervaluation of innovative medicines and vaccines by successive UK governments."

raw.headline: Merck to scrap London drug research centre

headline: Merck manager’s awkward whispers didn’t constitute harassment, judge rules
summary: The plaintiff, who spoke with a “heavy African accent,” said a manager’s comment that his voice is “very specific” was discriminatory.

headline: Kriya, Odyssey secure ‘megarounds’; Amgen boosts R&D leadership
summary: Kriya’s $320 million raise ranks as one of the year’s largest private funding rounds. Elsewhere, a Genentech veteran joined Amgen and Merck and Daiichi touted results for a new kind of antibody-drug conjugate.
